meanings.definition: Having a rank, unpleasant smell or taste.
meanings.sent1: The rancider milk made me scrunch up my nose.
meanings.sent2: The rancider cheese was thrown away due to its foul odor.
meanings.sent3: The rancider smell in the kitchen was so strong, it chased the cat away.
meanings.sent4: The rancider stench of the garbage can lingered in the air for hours.
meanings.sent5: The rancider taste of the spoiled fruit was unforgettable.

meanings.sent1: Leaving the food out caused it to rancider quickly.

meanings.sent3: The forgotten sandwich began to rancider in the lunchbox.
meanings.sent4: Time can make even the sweetest fruit rancider.
meanings.sent5: The warm weather made the milk rancider sooner than expected.

meanings.definition: A substance that has become rancid.
meanings.sent1: The rancider was thrown out to avoid any health risks.
meanings.sent2: The kitchen smelled of various ranciders left in the trash.
meanings.sent3: The rancider in the fridge was a reminder to clean it out regularly.
meanings.sent4: The bakery disposed of all the ranciders to maintain freshness.
